commentary:
(VIN 1.1.1) s'ājīvaṃ nāma yaṃ bhagavatā paññattaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ, etaṃ sājīvaṃ nāma. tasmiṃ sikkhati, tena vuccati sājīvasamāpanno'ti.
(ANa) sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno'ti yā bhikkhūnaṃ adhisīlasaṅkhātā sikkhā, tañ'ca, yattha c'ete saha jīvanti, ekajīvikā sabhāgavuttino honti, taṃ bhagavatā paññattasikkhāpadasaṅkhātaṃ sājīvañ'ca tattha sikkhanabhāvena samāpanno'ti bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno.

(VIN 1.4.1.8) bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissā'ti bhikkhuss'atthāya, bhikkhuṃ ārammaṇaṃ karitvā, bhikkhuṃ acchādetu'kāmo.

meaning_1: acquiring; appropriating; taking possession; grasping; clinging; identifying
sbs_example_1: vedanāpaccayā taṇhā, taṇhāpaccayā upādānaṃ, upādānapaccayā bhavo, bhavapaccayā jāti, jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇaṃ sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā sambhavanti.
sbs_example_2: saḷ'āyatananirodho, saḷ'āyatananirodhā, phassanirodho, phassanirodhā, vedanānirodho, vedanānirodhā, taṇhānirodho, taṇhānirodhā, upādānanirodho
sbs_example_3: pañcasu kho, nāgita, upādānakkhandhesu udayabbay'ānupassino viharato upādāne pāṭikulyatā saṇṭhāti, eso tassa nissando'ti.

commentary: (SNa) upādānan'ti daḷhaggahaṇaṃ vuccati. daḷh'attho hi ettha upasaddo upāyāsaupakaṭṭh'ādīsu viya. pañcakāmaguṇikarāgass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. ayam'ettha saṅkhepo.

sbs_example_2: yāyaṃ taṇhā ponobbhavikā nandirāgasahagatā tatratatr'ābhinandinī seyyath'īdaṃ kāmataṇhā bhavataṇhā vibhavataṇhā
sbs_chant_eng_2: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_3: kabaḷīkāre ce, bhikkhave, āhāre atthi rāgo atthi nandī atthi taṇhā, patiṭṭhitaṃ tattha viññāṇaṃ virūḷhaṃ. yattha patiṭṭhitaṃ viññāṇaṃ virūḷhaṃ, atthi tattha nāmarūpassa avakkanti.
sbs_example_4:
aññaṃ ito y'ābhivadanti dhammaṃ,
aparaddhā suddhim'akevalī te,

commentary: (SNa) rāgo'tiādīni lobhass'eva nāmāni. so hi rañjanavasena rāgo, nandanavasena nandī, taṇhāyanavasena taṇhā'ti vuccati.

meaning_1: pile of fuel (for the fire); heap of acquisition; physical and mental conglomerations that are clung to; pile of matter and mind that are held onto as a self; grasping group

sbs_example_3: so evaṃ pajānāti, evañ'hi kira imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ saṅgaho sannipāto samavāyo hoti.
sbs_example_4: yāvakīvañ'c'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ evaṃ assādañ'ca assādato ādīnavañ'ca ādīnavato nissaraṇañ'ca nissaraṇato yathābhūtaṃ n'ābbhaññāsiṃ
commentary: (KPa) tattha pañcā'ti gaṇanaparicchedo. upādānajanitā upādānajanakā vā khandhā upādānakkhandhā. yaṃkiñci rūpaṃ, vedanā, saññā, saṅkhārā, viññāṇañ'ca sāsavā upādāniyā, etesam'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.

meaning_1: should be given up (by); should be abandoned (by)
sbs_example_1: taṃ kho pan'idaṃ dukkhasamudayaṃ ariyasaccaṃ pahātabban'ti
sbs_chant_eng_1: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_2: kull'ūpamaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desitaṃ, ājānantehi dhammā'pi vo pahātabbā pag'eva adhammā.
sbs_example_3:
abhiññeyyaṃ abhiññātaṃ,
bhāvetabbañ'ca bhāvitaṃ,
pahātabbaṃ pahīnaṃ me,

sbs_example_4: tassa evaṃ yoniso manasikaroto tīṇi saṃyojanāni pahīyanti, sakkāyadiṭṭhi, vicikicchā, sīlabbataparāmāso. ime vuccanti āsavā dassanā pahātabbā.

sbs_example_1: yo c'āyaṃ kāmesu kāmasukh'allik'ānuyogo hīno gammo pothujjaniko anariyo anatthasañhito

sbs_example_3: na kāmasukham'anuyuñjeyya hīnaṃ gammaṃ pothujjanikaṃ anariyaṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ, na ca attakilamath'ānuyogam'anuyuñjeyya dukkhaṃ anariyaṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
yo attano sīlavatāni jantu, anānupuṭṭho'va paresa pāva,

meaning_1: as long as I; until I
sbs_example_1: n'eva tāv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddho'ti paccaññāsiṃ
sbs_chant_eng_1: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_2: na tāv'āhaṃ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me bhikkhuniyo na sāvikā bhavissanti viyattā vinītā visāradā bahussutā dhammadharā dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipannā
sbs_example_3: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno evaṃ vadeyya, na tāv'āhaṃ, āvuso, etasmiṃ sikkhāpade sikkhissāmi, yāva na aññaṃ bhikkhuṃ byattaṃ vinayadharaṃ paripucchāmī'ti, pācittiyaṃ.

sbs_chant_eng_1: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_2: yehi tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bālo veditabbo te tayo dhamme abhinivajjetvā, yehi tīhi dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito veditabbo te tayo dhamme samādāya vattissāmā'ti.
sbs_example_3: kati pan'āvuso, bhavā'ti? tayo'me, āvuso, bhavā, kāmabhavo, rūpabhavo, arūpabhavo'ti.

meaning_1: this is the last; this is the final

sbs_example_1: yāvakīvañ'ca me, bhikkhave, imesu catūsu ariyasaccesu evan'tiparivaṭṭaṃ dvādas'ākāraṃ yathābhūtaṃ ñāṇadassanaṃ na suvisuddhaṃ ahosi,
sbs_chant_eng_1: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
commentary: (SNa) tiparivaṭṭan'ti saccañāṇa-kiccañāṇa-katañāṇa-saṅkhātānaṃ tiṇṇaṃ parivaṭṭānaṃ vasena tiparivaṭṭaṃ. ettha hi idaṃ dukkhaṃ ariyasaccaṃ, idaṃ dukkhasamudayan'ti evaṃ catūsu saccesu yathābhūtaṃ ñāṇaṃ saccañāṇaṃ nāma. tesu'y'eva pariññeyyaṃ pahātabban'ti evaṃ kattabbakiccajānanañāṇaṃ kiccañāṇaṃ nāma. pariññātaṃ pahīnan'ti evaṃ tassa tassa kiccassa katabhāvajānanañāṇaṃ katañāṇaṃ nāma.

sbs_example_2: accayo maṃ, bhante, accagamā, yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, y'āhaṃ evam'akāsiṃ. tassā me, bhante, ayyo ānando accayaṃ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu, āyatiṃ saṃvarāyā'ti.
sbs_example_3: ayaṃ me mātā, tassā me mātu ayaṃ mātā'ti, apariyādinnā'va bhikkhave, tassa purisassa mātumātaro assu, atha imasmiṃ jambudīpe tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ gaccheyya.
sbs_example_4: yo ca tassā bhikkhuparisāya pattapariyanto so tassa bhikkhuno padātabbo, ayaṃ te, bhikkhu, patto, yāva bhedanāya dhāretabbo'ti.

sbs_example_2: so tena ñattena attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti. ayam'pi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.
sbs_example_3:
yāva hi vanatho na chijjati, aṇumatto'pi narassa nārisu,
paṭibaddhamano'va tāva so, vaccho khīrapako'va mātari.
sbs_example_4: imesam'pi hi, bho gotama, brāhmaṇānaṃ dissati anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā yadidaṃ, ajjhene.

sbs_example_2: na kāmasukham'anuyuñjeyya hīnaṃ gammaṃ pothujjanikaṃ anariyaṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ, na ca attakilamath'ānuyogam'anuyuñjeyya dukkhaṃ anariyaṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ.

meaning_1: who takes delight here and there; thoroughly enjoying this and that; very happy with this and that
sbs_example_1: y'āyaṃ taṇhā ponobhavikā nandirāgasahagatā tatratatr'ābhinandinī, seyyath'idaṃ, kāmataṇhā bhavataṇhā vibhavataṇhā
sbs_chant_eng_1: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

meaning_1: and this; but this; than this
sbs_example_1: yo c'āyaṃ attakilamath'ānuyogo dukkho anariyo anatthasañhito.
sbs_chant_eng_1: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_2: yo c'āyaṃ kāmesu kāmasukh'allik'ānuyogo hīno gammo pothujjaniko anariyo anatthasañhito
sbs_chant_eng_2: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_3: yo c'āyaṃ bhikkhu saññāvedayitanirodhaṃ samāpanno tassa'pi kāyasaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, vacīsaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, cittasaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, āyu na parikkhīṇo, usmā avūpasantā, indriyāni vippasannāni.
sbs_example_4:
yo sahassaṃ sahassena,
saṅgāme mānuse jine,
ekañ'ca jeyya'm'attānaṃ,
sa ve saṅgāmaj'uttamo,
attā have jitaṃ seyyo,
yā c'āyaṃ itarā pajā.

meaning_1: the Middle Way; (comm) not approaching two sides, greed and hatred, freed from them
sbs_example_1: ete kho, bhikkhave, ubho ante anupagamma majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati
sbs_chant_eng_1: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
commentary: (MNa) atthi majjhimā paṭipadā'ti maggaṃ sandhāya idaṃ vuttaṃ. maggo hi lobho eko anto, doso eko antoti ete dve ante na upeti, na upagacchati, vimutto etehi antehi, tasmā “majjhimā paṭipadā”ti vuccati.
feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here

sbs_example_1: yā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhi tamhi sattanikāye jarā jīraṇatā khaṇḍiccaṃ pāliccaṃ valittacatā āyuno saṃhāni indriyānaṃ paripāko, ayaṃ vuccati jarā.
sbs_example_2: upādānanirodhā, bhavanirodho, bhavanirodhā, jātinirodho, jātinirodhā, jarāmaraṇaṃ sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā nirujjhanti.
sbs_example_3:
aṭṭhīnaṃ nagaraṃ kataṃ,
maṃsalohitalepanaṃ,
yattha jarā ca maccu ca,
māno makkho ca ohito.
sbs_example_4:
evaṃ ādittako loko,
jarāya maraṇena ca,
nīhareth'eva dānena,
dinnaṃ hoti sunīhataṃ.
feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here

sbs_example_1: dve'me, bhikkhave, antā pabbajitena na sevitabbā.
sbs_chant_eng_1: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_2: dve'me, bhikkhave, bālā. katame dve? yo ca accayaṃ accayato na passati, yo ca accayaṃ desentassa yathādhammaṃ nappaṭiggaṇhāti. ime kho, bhikkhave, dve bālā'ti.
sbs_example_3: dve'me, bhikkhave, rogā. katame dve. kāyiko ca rogo cetasiko ca rogo
sbs_example_4: dve'me, bhikkhave, dhammā. katame dve? paggāho ca avikkhepo ca.
feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here

sbs_example_1: idaṃ dukkhaṃ ariyasaccan'ti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṃ udapādi, ñāṇaṃ udapādi, paññā udapādi, vijjā udapādi, āloko udapādi.
sbs_chant_eng_1: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_2: seyyathā'pi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ samma'd'eva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya, evam'eva yasassa kulaputtassa tasmiṃ'y'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi, yaṃ kiñci samudayadhammaṃ, sabbaṃ taṃ nirodhadhamman'ti.
sbs_example_3: ñāṇañ'ca pana me dassanaṃ udapādi. akuppā me vimutti, ayamantimā jāti, n'atthi dāni punabbhavo'ti
feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here

sbs_example_1: n'eva tāv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddho'ti paccaññāsiṃ
sbs_chant_eng_1: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_2: na khv'āhaṃ taṃ, brāhmaṇa, passāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya, yassa so pāyaso bhutto sammā pariṇāmaṃ gaccheyya, aññatra tathāgatassa vā tathāgatasāvakassa vā.
sbs_example_3: so imaṃ lokaṃ sadevakaṃ samārakaṃ sabrahmakaṃ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṃ pajaṃ sadevamanussaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.

meaning_1: path of practice leading to the cessation of suffering

sbs_example_1: n'eva tāv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddho'ti paccaññāsiṃ

sbs_example_1: n'eva tāv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddho'ti paccaññāsiṃ
sbs_chant_eng_1: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_2: sādhu, devo, vāhanāgāresu ca dvāresu ca āṇāpetu, yena vāhanena jīvako icchati tena vāhanena gacchatu, yena dvārena icchati tena dvārena gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ pavisatū'ti.
sbs_example_3: devassa kho dānaṃ dīyati, amhākaṃ dānaṃ na dīyati. sādhu mayam'pi devaṃ nissāya dānāni dadeyyāma, puññāni kareyyāmā'ti.

meaning_1: five heaps that are clung to; five grasping groups
sbs_example_1: jāti'pi dukkhā, jarā'pi dukkhā, maraṇam'pi dukkhaṃ, sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā'pi dukkhā, appiyehi sampayogo'pi dukkho, piyehi vippayogo'pi dukkho, yam'p'icchaṃ na labhati tam'pi dukkhaṃ, saṅkhittena pañc'upādānakkhandhā dukkhā.
sbs_chant_eng_1: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_2: so gacchati ce'pi ime pañc'upādānakkhandhe upagacchati. tiṭṭhati ce'pi ime pañc'upādānakkhandhe upatiṭṭhati. nisīdati ce'pi ime pañc'upādānakkhandhe upanisīdati. nipajjati ce'pi ime pañc'upādānakkhandhe upanipajjati.
sbs_example_3: ye hi keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussaramānā anussaranti sabb'ete pañc'upādānakkhandhe anussaranti etesaṃ vā aññataraṃ.
commentary: (KPa) tattha pañcā'ti gaṇanaparicchedo. upādānajanitā upādānajanakā vā khandhā upādānakkhandhā. yaṃkiñci rūpaṃ, vedanā, saññā, saṅkhārā, viññāṇañ'ca sāsavā upādāniyā, etesam'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here

sbs_example_1: nandī dukkhassa mūlan'ti, iti viditvā bhavā jāti bhūtassa jarāmaraṇan'ti. tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, tathāgato sabbaso taṇhānaṃ khayā virāgā nirodhā cāgā paṭinissaggā anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddho'ti vadāmī'ti.

sbs_example_1: so evaṃ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigat'ūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte pubbenivās'ānussatiñāṇāya cittaṃ abhininnāmeti.
sbs_example_2: vippasannāni kho te, gahapati, indriyāni, parisuddho mukhavaṇṇo pariyodāto.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte acche vā udakapatte sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno

sbs_example_2: seyyathā'pi, āvuso, dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā tiṇhena govikantanena kucchiṃ parikanteyya, evam'eva kho adhimattā vātā kucchiṃ parikantanti.
sbs_example_3: hatthesu, bhikkhave, sati ādānanikkhepanaṃ paññāyati, pādesu sati abhikkamapaṭikkamo paññāyati, pabbesu sati samiñjanapasāraṇaṃ paññāyati, kucchismiṃ sati jighacchā pipāsā paññāyati.

sbs_example_1: aj'eḷakapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti, kukkuṭasūkarapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti
sbs_example_2: tasmiṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, yaññe n'eva gāvo haññiṃsu, na aj'eḷakā haññiṃsu, na kukkuṭasūkarā haññiṃsu, na vividhā pāṇā saṃghātaṃ āpajjiṃsu, na rukkhā chijjiṃsu yūpatthāya, na dabbhā lūyiṃsu barihisatthāya
sbs_example_3: ime kho, bhikkhave, dve sukkā dhammā lokaṃ na pāleyyuṃ, na'y'idha paññāyetha mātā'ti vā mātucchā'ti vā mātulānī'ti vā ācariyabhariyā'ti vā garūnaṃ dārā'ti vā. sambhedaṃ loko agamissa, yathā ajeḷakā kukkuṭasūkarā soṇasiṅgālā.

meaning_1: controlled by restraint of Patimokkha; restrained and controlled by the Pātimokkha precepts
sbs_example_1: sampannasīlā, bhikkhave, viharatha sampannapātimokkhā, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvutā viharatha ācāragocarasampannā aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvino, samādāya sikkhatha sikkhāpadesu.
sbs_example_2: pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharāhi ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesū'”ti.
sbs_example_3: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.

meaning_1: accepting gold and silver; receiving gold and money

sbs_example_2: jātarūparajatapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato ahosiṃ, āmakadhaññapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato ahosiṃ, āmakamaṃsapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato ahosiṃ

meaning_1: goes forth from home to homelessness; leaves home to become a monk
sbs_example_1: atha kho bho mahāgovindo brāhmaṇo tassa satt'āhassa accayena kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbaji
sbs_example_2: evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, cattāri bhayāni idh'ekaccassa kulaputtassa imasmiṃ dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitassa pāṭikaṅkhitabbāni.
sbs_example_3: yass'atthāya kulaputtā samma'd'eva agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajanti
sbs_example_4: ye'me, bho gotama, puggalā assaddhā jīvik'atthā na saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitā saṭhā māyāvino ketabino uddhatā unnaḷā capalā ... na tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.

sbs_example_2: mahāsamuddo anupubbaninno anupubbapoṇo anupubbapabbhāro, na āyataken'eva papāto
commentary: (ITIa) anupubbenā'ti sīl'ādivisuddhipaṭipāṭiyā, tattha ca vipassanāpaṭipāṭiyā c'eva maggapaṭipāṭiyā ca.

grammar: ind, adv, comp, acc sg of pacchābhatta
meaning_1: after eating; after the meal; in the late morning
sbs_example_1: so pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā, ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya, parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
sbs_example_2: tena kho pana samayena sambahulānaṃ therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantānaṃ maṇḍalamāḷe sannisinnānaṃ sannipatitānaṃ ayam'antarākathā udapādi, vuttam'idaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā pārāyane metteyyapañhe.
sbs_example_3: yo pana bhikkhu nimantito sabhatto samāno santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā purebhattaṃ vā pacchābhattaṃ vā kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjeyya aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.
commentary:
(VIN 2.5.5.6) pacchābhattaṃ nāma yena nimantito taṃ antamaso kus'aggena'pi bhuttaṃ hoti.
(ANa) pacchābhattan'ti bhattassa pacchato.

sbs_example_2: so abhijjhaṃ loke pahāya vigat'ābhijjhena cetasā viharati, abhijjhāya cittaṃ parisodheti.
sbs_example_3: ye'pi hi keci, rāhula, anāgatam'addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā kāyakammaṃ parisodhessanti … sabbe te evam'evaṃ paccavekkhitvā paccavekkhitvā kāyakammaṃ parisodhessanti

meaning_1: gradual undertaking; step-by-step activity; successive process
sbs_example_1: seyyathā'pi, bho gotama, imassa migāramātupāsādassa dissati anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā yadidaṃ, yāva pacchimasopānakaḷevarā.
sbs_example_3: evam'evaṃ kho pahārāda imasmiṃ dhammavinaye anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā na āyataken'eva aññāpaṭivedho
commentary: (UDa) tattha anupubbasikkhāya tisso bhikkhā gahitā, anupubbakiriyāya terasa dhut'aṅgadhammā, anupubbapaṭipadāya satta anupassanā aṭṭhārasa mahāvipassanā aṭṭhatiṃsa ārammaṇavibhattiyo sattatiṃsa bodhipakkhiyadhammā ca gahitā.

no'pi asaññī na vibhūtasaññī,

saññānidānā hi papañcasaṅkhā.
sbs_example_3: tasmā't'iha, moggallāna, yathāsaññissa te viharato taṃ middhaṃ okkamati taṃ saññaṃ mā manas'ākāsi taṃ saññaṃ mā bahulam'akāsi
sbs_example_4: vohāravepakkaṃ saññaṃ vadāmi. yathā yathā naṃ sañjānāti tathā tathā voharati, evaṃ saññī ahosin'ti. ayaṃ vuccati saññānaṃ vipāko.

abhiññeyyaṃ abhiññātaṃ,

grammar: ind, adv, comp, acc sg of yathābhūta
meaning_1: as it truly is; in reality

commentary:
(MNa) atthasaṃhitan'ti anekehi'pi nayehi vibhajantena pariyādātuṃ asakkuṇeyyatāya atthasampannaṃ, yaṃ vā so atthavādī atthaṃ vadati, tena atthena saṃhitattā atthasaṃhitaṃ vācaṃ bhāsati, na aññaṃ nikkhipitvā aññaṃ bhāsatī'ti vuttaṃ hoti.

meaning_1: Such Become; Realised; being in such a state; arrived at the truth; epithet of the Buddha
sbs_example_1: evam'eva kho brāhmaṇa tathāgato purisadammaṃ labhitvā paṭhamaṃ evaṃ vineti, ehi tvaṃ bhikkhu sīlavā hohi
sbs_example_2: so taṃ dhammaṃ sutvā tathāgate saddhaṃ paṭilabhati. so tena saddhāpaṭilābhena samannāgato iti paṭisañcikkhati
sbs_example_3: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, handa dāni, bhikkhave, āmantayāmi vo, vayadhammā saṅkhārā appamādena sampādethā'ti. ayaṃ tathāgatassa pacchimā vācā.
sbs_example_4: n'āhaṃ taṃ, bhikkhave, passāmi ... yo imesaṃ pañhānaṃ veyyākaraṇena cittaṃ ārādheyya, aññatra tathāgatena vā tathāgatasāvakena vā ito vā pana sutvā.
notes: Bhikkhu Sujāta: the EBTs give a fairly extensive set of interpretations for tathāgata, for example, "as he says, so he does". The overall sense is of one who speaks and acts in accordance with his realization of the truth, which fits the translation "the Realized One".

(VINa) thero vā'ti ādīsu vayovuḍḍh'ādīsu yo vā so vā hotu, paripuṇṇadasavassatāya thero vā ūnapañcavassatāya navo vā atirekapañcavassatāya majjhimo vā'ti attho.
(SNa) navo'ti aparipuṇṇapañcavasso hi bhikkhu navo nāma hoti, pañcavassato paṭṭhāya majjhimo, dasavassato paṭṭhāya thero.

sbs_example_1: evaṃ svākkhāte, bhikkhave, mayā dhamme uttāne vivaṭe pakāsite chinnapilotike ye te bhikkhū arahanto khīṇ'āsavoā vusitavanto katakaraṇīyā ohitabhārā anuppattasadatthā parikkhīṇabhavasaṃyojanā sammadaññā vimuttā, vaṭṭaṃ tesaṃ n'atthi paññāpanāya.
commentary: (MNa) chinnapilotiko'ti pilotikā vuccati chinnaṃ bhinnaṃ tattha tattha sibbitaṃ gaṇṭhikataṃ jiṇṇaṃ vatthaṃ, taṃ yassa n'atthi, aṭṭhahatthaṃ vā navahatthaṃ vā ahatasāṭakaṃ nivattho, so chinnapilotiko nāma. ayam'pi dhammo tādiso, na hettha kohaññ'ādivasena chinnabhinnasibbitagaṇṭhikatabhāvo atthi. apica kacavaro pilotiko'ti vuccati. imasmiñ'ca sāsane samaṇakacavaraṃ nāma patiṭṭhātuṃ na labhati.

sbs_example_2: tasmiṃ samaye satthā pavattitavaradhammacakko anupubben'āgantvā anāthapiṇḍikena mahāseṭṭhinā catupaṇṇāsakoṭidhanaṃ vissajjetvā kārite jetavanamahāvihāre viharati mahājanaṃ saggamagge ca mokkhamagge ca patiṭṭhāpayamāno.
sbs_example_3: iti kho, bhikkhave, vīsati kusalapakkhā, vīsati akusalapakkhā, mahācattārīsako dhammapariyāyo pavattito appaṭivattiyo samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā mārena vā brahmunā vā kenaci vā lokasmiṃ.

meaning_1: belonging to the (Heaven of the) Thirty Three

sbs_chant_eng_1: The Discourse on  Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_2: yadā, bhante, brahmā sanaṅkumāro devānaṃ tāvatiṃsānaṃ pātubhavati, na tassaṃ parisāyaṃ koci devo abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimanteti.
sbs_example_3: tena sudaṃ, bhante, devatā tāvatiṃsā attamanā honti pamuditā pītisomanassajātā dibbā vata bho kāyā paripūrenti, hāyanti asurakāyā'ti
sbs_example_4:

sbs_chant_eng_1: The Discourse on  Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_2: ayañ'hi dīp'obhāsaṃ vā aggi'obhāsaṃ vā adisvā maṇiāloken'eva bhuñjati ca nisīdati ca nipajjati ca, devo pana dīp'ālokena nisinno bhavissatī'ti?
sbs_example_3: yathā kho, mārisā, nimittāni dissanti, uḷāro āloko sañjāyati, obhāso pātubhavati, brahmā pātubhavissati
sbs_example_4:
obhāsajātaṃ phalagaṃ, cittaṃ yassa abhiṇhaso.

meaning_1: Brahma’s realm; world of the gods
sbs_example_1: itiha tena khaṇena tena muhuttena yāva brahmalokā saddo abbhuggacchi.
sbs_chant_eng_1: The Discourse on  Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_2:
ko sujjhati muccati bajjhatī ca,
ken'attanā gacchati brahmalokaṃ,
ajānato me muni brūhi puṭṭho,
bhagavā hi me sakkhi brahmajjadiṭṭho,
tuvañ'hi no brahmasamo'si saccaṃ,
kathaṃ upapajjati brahmalokaṃ jutima.
sbs_example_3:
ayaṃ loko paro loko,
brahmaloko sadevako,
diṭṭhiṃ te n'ābhijānāti,
gotamassa yasassino.
sbs_example_4: tuvaṭaṃ cittaṃ samādhiyati, mukhavaṇṇo vippasīdati, asammūḷho kālaṃ karoti, uttari appaṭivijjhanto brahmalok'ūpago hoti.

sbs_example_2: maraṇañ'h'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, ariyassa vinaye yo sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattati, maraṇamattañ'h'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, dukkhaṃ yaṃ aññataraṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
sbs_example_3: dīgharattañ'h'etaṃ, bhikkhave, assutavato puthujjanassa ajjhositaṃ mamāyitaṃ parāmaṭṭhaṃ
sbs_example_4:
iti h'etaṃ vijānāma, navamo so parābhavo.
dutiyaṃ bhagavā brūhi, kiṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.

meaning_1: perception; conception; recognition; third of the five aggregates
sbs_example_1: saññā anattā. saññā ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissa, na'y'idaṃ saññā ābādhāya saṃvatteyya, labbhetha ca saññāya, evaṃ me saññā hotu, evaṃ me saññā mā ahosī'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_1: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_2: katamā ca, bhikkhave, saññā? cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, saññākāyā, rūpasaññā, saddasaññā, gandhasaññā, rasasaññā, phoṭṭhabbasaññā, dhammasaññā. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, saññā.
sbs_example_3:
saññaṃ pariññā vitareyya oghaṃ,
pariggahesu muni n'opalitto,
abbūḷhasallo caram'appamatto,
n'āsīsatī lokam'imaṃ parañ'cā'ti.
sbs_example_4: nīlam'pi sañjānāti, pītakam'pi sañjānāti, lohitakam'pi sañjānāti, odātam'pi sañjānāti. sañjānātī'ti kho, bhikkhave, tasmā saññā'ti vuccati.
feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here

grammar: ind, adv, abl sg of ya
sbs_example_1: yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ anattā, tasmā rūpaṃ ābādhāya saṃvattati, na ca labbhati rūpe, evaṃ me rūpaṃ hotu, evaṃ me rūpaṃ mā ahosī'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_1: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_2: yasmā ca kho, kassapa, aññatr'eva imāya mattāya aññatra iminā tapopakkamena sāmaññaṃ vā hoti brahmaññaṃ vā dukkaraṃ sudukkaraṃ, tasmā etaṃ kallaṃ vacanāya, dukkaraṃ sāmaññaṃ dukkaraṃ brahmaññan'ti.
sbs_example_3: yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, sakkā akusalaṃ pajahituṃ tasm'āhaṃ evaṃ vadāmi, akusalaṃ, bhikkhave, pajahathā'ti.
feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here

meaning_1: may they not be; may they not exist
sbs_example_1: saṅkhārā ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissaṃsu, na'y'idaṃ saṅkhārā ābādhāya saṃvatteyyuṃ, labbhetha ca saṅkhāresu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā hontu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā mā ahesun'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_1: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_3: byāpannacitto hoti paduṭṭhamanasaṅkappo, ime sattā haññantu vā bajjhantu vā ucchijjantu vā vinassantu vā mā vā ahesun'ti.
commentary: (MNa) mā vā ahesun'ti kiñci'pi mā ahesuṃ. idhā'pi kopamattakena kammapathabhedo na hoti. haññantū'tiādicintanen'eva hoti, tasmā evaṃ vuttaṃ.

grammar: ind, prep, loc sg of santika
meaning_1: to; in the presence (of); near (to); nearby; close (to); on the verge (of)
sbs_example_1: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, yaṃ kiñci rūpaṃ atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā hīnaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā yaṃ dūre santike vā
sbs_chant_eng_1: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_2:
n'atthi jhānaṃ apaññassa,
paññā n'atthi ajhāyato,
yamhi jhānañ'ca paññā ca,
sa ve nibbānasantike.
sbs_example_3:
satañ'ca vivaṭaṃ hoti,
āloko passatām'iva,
santike na vijānanti,
magā dhammass'akovidā.
sbs_example_4: dūrato'pi kho mayaṃ, āvuso, āgaccheyyāma āyasmato sāriputtassa santike etassa bhāsitassa attham'aññātuṃ
synonym: abhito, upanissāya, nissāya, santikaṃ, samīpaṃ, samīpe, sāmantā

meaning_1: do not; may one not; don’t let
sbs_example_1: tam'enaṃ tathāgato uttariṃ vineti, ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, indriyesu guttadvāro hohi, cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā mā nimittaggāhī hohi m'ānubyañjanaggāhī
sbs_example_2: rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, anattā. rūpañ'ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissa, na'y'idaṃ rūpaṃ ābādhāya saṃvatteyya, labbhetha ca rūpe, evaṃ me rūpaṃ hotu, evaṃ me rūpaṃ mā ahosī'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_2: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_3: etha tumhe, kālāmā, mā anussavena, mā paramparāya, mā itikirāya, mā piṭakasampadānena, mā takkahetu, mā nayahetu, mā ākāraparivitakkena, mā diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā, mā bhabbarūpatāya, mā samaṇo no garū'ti.
sbs_example_4: alaṃ, ānanda, mā soci mā paridevi, nanu etaṃ, ānanda, mayā paṭikacc'eva akkhātaṃ – sabbeh'eva piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo aññathābhāvo
feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here

meaning_1: becomes detached (from); loses interest (in); becomes dispassionate (towards); gets bored (with)
sbs_example_1: nibbindaṃ virajjati, virāgā vimuccati. vimuttasmiṃ vimuttam'iti ñāṇaṃ hoti. 'khīṇā jāti vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ n'āparaṃ itthattāyā'ti pajānātī'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_1: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_2:
dhono na hi tena maññati,
yadidaṃ diṭṭhasutaṃ mutesu vā,
n'āññena visuddhim'icchati,
na hi so rajjati no virajjatī'ti.
sbs_example_3: rañño'pi kho, bhikkhave, pasenadissa kosalassa atth'eva aññathattaṃ atthi vipariṇāmo. evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako tasmim'pi nibbindati. tasmiṃ nibbindanto agge virajjati, pag'eva hīnasmiṃ.

grammar: pron, comp, nt nom sg of yaṅkaci
sbs_example_1: yaṅ'kiñci rūpaṃ atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā
sbs_chant_eng_1: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here

sbs_example_1: evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako rūpasmim'pi nibbindati, vedanāya'pi nibbindati, saññāya'pi nibbindati, saṅkhāresu'pi nibbindati, viññāṇasmim'pi nibbindati.
sbs_chant_eng_1: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_2: idha, gahapati, sutavā ariyasāvako ariyānaṃ dassāvī ariyadhammassa kovido ariyadhamme suvinīto sappurisānaṃ dassāvī sappurisadhammassa kovido sappurisadhamme suvinīto na rūpaṃ attato samanupassati
sbs_example_3: tatra, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho eta'r'ahi rūpena khajjāmi. atītam'p'āhaṃ addhānaṃ evam'eva rūpena khajjiṃ, seyyathā'pi eta'r'ahi paccuppannena rūpena khajjāmi
sbs_example_4: tatra, bhikkhave, ko viseso ko adhippayāso kiṃ nānākaraṇaṃ sutavato ariyasāvakassa assutavatā puthujjanenā'ti?
feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here

sbs_example_1: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, yaṃ kiñci rūpaṃ atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā hīnaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā yaṃ dūre santike vā, sabbaṃ rūpaṃ, n'etaṃ mama, n'eso'ham'asmi, na m'eso attā'ti evam'etaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ
sbs_chant_eng_1: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_2:
yo appaduṭṭhassa narassa dussati,
suddhassa posassa anaṅgaṇassa,
tam'eva bālaṃ pacceti pāpaṃ,
sukhumo rajo paṭivātaṃ'va khitto.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, dakkho palagaṇḍo vā palagaṇḍ'antevāsī vā sukhumāya āṇiyā oḷārikaṃ āṇiṃ abhinihaneyya abhinīhareyya abhinivatteyya.

sbs_example_1: nibbindaṃ virajjati, virāgā vimuccati. vimuttasmiṃ vimuttam'iti ñāṇaṃ hoti. 'khīṇā jāti vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ n'āparaṃ itthattāyā'ti pajānātī'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_1: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_2:
accī yathā vātavegena khittā,
atthaṃ paleti na upeti saṅkhaṃ,
evaṃ munī nāmakāyā vimutto,
atthaṃ paleti na upeti saṅkhaṃ.
sbs_example_3: atha pacchāpure asaṃkhittaṃ vimuttaṃ appaṇihitan'ti pajānāti. atha ca pana kāye kāy'ānupassī viharāmi ātāpī sampajāno satimā sukham'asmī'ti pajānāti.
sbs_example_4: ye pana te bhikkhū arahanto khīṇ'āsavā vusitavanto katakaraṇīyā ohitabhārā anuppattasadatthā parikkhīṇabhavasaṃyojanā sammadaññā vimuttā tesaṃ ime dhammā diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārāya c'eva saṃvattanti, satisampajaññāya cā'ti.

sbs_example_1: tatra kho bhagavā pañcavagg'iye bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca.

sbs_example_2:
attaṃ pahāya anupādiyāno,
ñāṇe'pi so nissayaṃ no karoti,

diṭṭhim'pi so na pacceti kiñci.

meaning_1: part of a group; belonging to a collection

meaning_1: precepts and practices; ethics and observances; rites and rituals
sbs_example_1:

sbs_example_2:

sbs_meaning: disciplinary code; precepts; training rules; lit. leading to freedom
sbs_example_1: uddiṭṭhaṃ kho tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena: ovādapāṭimokkhaṃ tīhi gāthāhi.
commentary: (KV) tattha pātimokkhan'ti paatimokkhaṃ atipamokkhaṃ atiseṭṭhaṃ atiuttaman'ti attho.

sbs_example_1: samādāya sikkhatha sikkhāpadesū'ti. evañ'hi no sikkhitabbaṃ.
sbs_example_2: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, kāyagatā sati no bhāvitā bhavissati bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā'ti.
sbs_example_3:
kassako paṭijānāsi,
na ca passāma te kasiṃ,
kasiṃ no pucchito brūhi,
yathā jānemu te kasiṃ.

meaning_1: exactly like this; in exactly the same way
sbs_example_1: evañ'hi te, moggallāna, sikkhitabbaṃ
sbs_example_2: tesaṃ te kārā amhesu mahapphalā bhavissanti mah'ānisaṃsā, amhākañ'c'ev'āyaṃ pabbajjā avañjhā bhavissati saphalā saudrayā'ti. evañ'hi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabbaṃ.
sbs_example_3: evañ'hi sā yavakalāpī suhatā assa chahi byābhaṅgīhi haññamānā. atha sattamo puriso āgaccheyya byābhaṅgihattho.
sbs_example_4: evañ'hi so, bhikkhave, maccho gilabaḷiso bāḷisikassa anayaṃ āpanno byasanaṃ āpanno yathākāmakaraṇīyo bāḷisikassa.

sbs_example_1: sampannasīlā, bhikkhave, viharatha sampannapātimokkhā, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvutā viharatha ācāragocarasampannā aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvino, samādāya sikkhatha sikkhāpadesu.
sbs_example_2:
tesaṃ sampannasīlānaṃ,
appamādavihārinaṃ,
samma'd'aññā vimuttānaṃ,
māro maggaṃ na vindati.

sbs_example_1: uddiṭṭhaṃ kho tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena
sbs_example_2: ko nu kho imassa bhagavatā saṃkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṃ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṃ vibhajeyyā'ti?
sbs_example_3: uddiṭṭhā kho āyasmanto cattāro pārājikā dhammā. yesaṃ bhikkhu aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā āpajjitvā na labhati bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ saṃvāsaṃ yathā pure, tathā pacchā, pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

sbs_example_1: handa mayaṃ sīla-uddesapāṭhaṃ bhaṇāmase
sbs_example_2: etāni pañca kammāni, chand'āharaṇ'ādīni pātimokkha-uddesato paṭhamaṃ kattabbatā, uposathassa uposathakammassa pubbakiccan'ti vuccati. pubbakiccānī'ti akkhātāni.
sbs_example_3: sādhikam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, diyaḍḍhasikkhāpadasataṃ anvaddhamāsaṃ uddesaṃ āgacchati yattha attakāmā kulaputtā sikkhanti.
sbs_example_4: parisuddh'etth'āyasmanto, tasmā tuṇhī. evam'etaṃ dhārayāmi. nidāna-uddeso paṭhamo.
